contentrichtext.text: In [[telecommunication]], the term '''transmission block''' has the following meanings: #A group of [[bit]]s or characters transmitted as a unit and usually containing an encoding procedure for [[error control]] purposes. #In [[data transmission]], a group of records sent, processed, or recorded as a unit. A transmission [[block (telecommunications)|block]] is usually terminated by an [[character (computing)|End Of Block character]] (EOB), [[End Transmission Block character]] (ETB), [[end-of-text character|End Of Text character]] (ETX), or [[End-of-transmission character|End Of Transmission character]] (EOT). == See also == * [[Packet (information technology)]] ==References== *{{FS1037C}} [[Category:Data transmission]]
